member.name: T:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle
member.summary: Class wrapper for the MSOracle .NET provider. Requires Oracle Native client to be installed on the machine using this class. (e.g. Oracle.DataAccess)

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.GetConnectionStringKeyVals
member.summary: Returns a list of key/value pairs that contains all the keys and their associated values for the current connection string.
member.returns: List in Key/Value format.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.CreateTable(System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Method creates a a table in the database based on the column definitions and table name contained in the DataTable parameter.
member.param: DataTable object.
member.returns: True if table created; otherwise false.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.CreateTable(System.Data.DataTable,System.String@)
member.summary: Method creates a a table in the database based on the column definitions and table name contained in the DataTable parameter.
member.param: DataTable object.
Copy of the script used to create the table.
member.returns: True if table created; otherwise false.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.TableExists(System.String)
member.summary: Method to determine if a table exists in the database.
member.param: Name of the table.
member.returns: True if table exists; otherwise false.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.TableExists(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Method to determine if a table exists in the database.
member.param: Schema or owner name for the table.
Name of the table.
member.returns: True if table exists; otherwise false.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.TableExists(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Method to determine if a table exists in the database.
member.param: Catalog name is ignored by this version of method.
Schema or owner name for the table.
Name of the table.
member.returns: True if table exists; otherwise false.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.DropTable(System.String)
member.summary: Method to drop a table from the database.
member.param: Name of the table.
member.returns: True if table no longer exists; otherwise returns false if table still exists.
member.remarks: There could be unexpected results from this method because schema name is not specified.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.DropTable(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Method to drop a table from the database.
member.param: Schema or owner name for the table.
Name of the table.
member.returns: True if table no longer exists; otherwise returns false if table still exists.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.DropTable(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Method to drop a table from the database.
member.param: Catalog name is ignored by this version of method.
Schema or owner name for the table.
Name of the table.
member.returns: True if table no longer exists; otherwise returns false if table still exists.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.BuildTableCreateStatement(System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Builds a SQL table create statement using the properties on the specified data table.
member.param: Object containing the table definition.
member.returns: String containing a SQL table create statement.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.OpenConnection
member.summary: Opens connection to database.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.CloseConnection
member.summary: Closes connection to database.

member.summary: Runs query specified via properties.
member.returns: Data reader object.

member.summary: Runs query specified by the parameters.
member.param: SQL to execute.
Type of command to run: text or stored procedure.
member.returns: Data reader object.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.RunQueryDataSet
member.summary: Runs query.
member.returns: Returns dataset object.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.RunQueryDataSet(System.String,System.Data.CommandType)
member.summary: Runs query specified by the parameters.
member.param: SQL to execute.
Type of command to run: text or stored procedure.
member.returns: Dataset object.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.RunQueryDataTable
member.summary: Runs query.

member.summary: Runs query specified by the parameters.

Type of command to run: text or stored procedure.
member.returns: DataTable object.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.RunNonQuery
member.summary: Runs a non-query (e.g. update, insert, delete statements).
member.returns: Number of rows affected.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.RunNonQuery(System.String,System.Data.CommandType)
member.summary: Runs a non-query (e.g. update, insert, delete statements) using the query specified in the parameters.
member.param: SQL to execute.
Type of command to run: text or stored procedure.
member.returns: Number of rows affected.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.GetQueryDataSchema
member.summary: Retrieves the data schema represented by the query text provided to this instance of the class.
member.returns: Returns data table object that contains schema for the query defined for this instance.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.GetQueryDataSchema(System.String,System.Data.CommandType)
member.summary: Retrieves the data schema represented by the query text provided to this routine.
member.param: SQL to parse.
Type of command represented by the query: text or stored procedure.
member.returns: DataTable object containing the schema information for the columns that would be returned by this query.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.ConvertDataReaderToDataTable(System.Data.Common.DbDataReader)
member.summary: Transforms a SqlDataReader object into a DataTable object.
member.param: SqlDataReader object.
member.returns: DataTable object.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.ConvertDataReaderToDataTable(System.Data.Common.DbDataReader,System.String)
member.summary: Transforms a SqlDataReader object into a DataTable object.
member.param: SqlDataReader object.
Name that identifies the table.
member.returns: DataTable object.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.ProcessDataReader(System.Data.Common.DbDataReader)
member.summary: Returns data from a SqlDataReader object to the caller.
member.param: SqlDataReader object containing data to be returned to the caller.
member.remarks: Results can be retrieved by subscribing to the ResultDelegate event.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.ProcessDataSet(System.Data.DataSet)
member.summary: Returns data from a DataSet to the caller.
member.param: DataSet object containing data to be returned to the caller.
member.remarks: Results can be retrieved by subscribing to ResultDelegate event.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.ProcessDataTable(System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Returns data from a DataTable to the caller.
member.param: DataTable object containing data to be returned to the caller.
member.remarks: Results can be retrieved by subscribing to the ResultDelegate event.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.ImportDataFromDataTable(System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Loads rows contained in an ADO.NET data table to an MSOracle database table. Table must already exist. See CreateTable methods to create a new table.
member.param: DataTable object containing data to load.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.ImportDataFromDataTable(System.Data.DataTable,System.Int32)
member.summary: Loads rows contained in an ADO.NET data table to an MSOracle database table. Table must already exist. See CreateTable methods to create a new table.
member.param: DataTable object containing data to load.
Number of individual SQL modification statements to include in a table modification operation.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.ProcessDataTable(System.Data.DataTable,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns data from a DataTable to the caller.
member.param: DataTable object containing data to be returned to the caller.
Arbitrary number used for identifying multiple DataTables.
member.remarks: Results can be retrieved by subscribing to the ResultDelegate Event.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.ExtractDelimitedDataFromDataReader(System.Data.Common.DbDataReader,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Produces data in delimited text format.
member.param: Data reader object.
One or more characters to denote end of a column.
One or more characters to denote end of a line. "\r\n" is the standard line terminator.
If true delimited list of column names is output at top of the data.
member.remarks: Results can be retrieved by subscribing to the ResultAsStringDelegate Event.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.ExtractDelimitedDataFromDataSet(System.Data.DataSet,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Produces data in delimited text format.
member.param: DataSet object.
One or more characters to denote end of a column.
One or more characters to denote end of a line. "\r\n" is the standard line terminator.
If true delimited list of column names is output at top of the data.
member.remarks: Results can be retrieved by subscribing to the ResultAsStringDelegate Event.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.ExtractDelimitedDataFromTable(System.Data.DataTable,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Produces data in delimited text format.
member.param: DataTable object.
One or more characters to denote end of a column.
One or more characters to denote end of a line. "\r\n" is the standard line terminator.
If true delimited list of column names is output at top of the data.
member.remarks: Results can be retrieved by subscribing to the ResultAsStringDelegate Event.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.ExtractFixedLengthDataFromDataReader(System.Data.Common.DbDataReader,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Produces data in fixed length text column format.
member.param: Data reader object.
If true, the output will be separated into lines using "\r\n" to terminate each line.
If true, a list of column names in fixed length column format is output at top of the data.
If true, data longer than column length will be truncated; otherwise an exception will be thrown.
member.remarks: Results can be retrieved by subscribing to the ResultAsStringDelegate Event.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.ExtractFixedLengthDataFromDataSet(System.Data.DataSet,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Produces data in fixed length text column format.
member.param: DataSet object.
If true, the output will be separated into lines using "\r\n" to terminate each line.
If true, a list of column names in fixed length column format is output at top of the data.
If true, data longer than column length will be truncated; otherwise an exception will be thrown.
member.remarks: Results can be retrieved by subscribing to the ResultAsStringDelegate Event.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.ExtractFixedLengthDataFromTable(System.Data.DataTable,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Produces data in fixed length text column format.
member.param: DataTable object.
If true, the output will be separated into lines using "\r\n" to terminate each line.
If true, a list of column names in fixed length column format is output at top of the data.
If true, data longer than column length will be truncated; otherwise an exception will be thrown.
member.remarks: Results can be retrieved by subscribing to the ResultAsStringDelegate Event.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.LoadXmlFileToDataTable(System.String)
member.summary: Reads contents of xml file into a DataTable
member.param: Location of Xml file.
member.returns: DataTable with data.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.LoadXmlFileToDataSet(System.String)
member.summary: Reads contents of xml file into a DataSet
member.param: Location of Xml file.
member.returns: DataSet with data.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.SaveDataReaderToXmlFile(System.Data.Common.DbDataReader,System.String)
member.summary: Writes contents of DataReader in Xml format to specified output file.
member.param: Data Reader object.
Location of the Xml output file.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.SaveDataReaderWithSchemaToXmlFile(System.Data.Common.DbDataReader,System.String)
member.summary: Writes contents of DataReader plus the data schema in Xml format to specified output file.
member.param: Data Reader object.
Location of the Xml output file.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.SaveDataReaderToXmlSchemaFile(System.Data.Common.DbDataReader,System.String)
member.summary: Writes data schema in Xsd format to specified output file.
member.param: Data Reader object.
Location of the Xsd output file.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.SaveDataTableToXmlFile(System.Data.DataTable,System.String)
member.summary: Writes contents of DataTable in Xml format to specified output file.
member.param: DataTable object.
Location of the Xml output file.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.SaveDataTableWithSchemaToXmlFile(System.Data.DataTable,System.String)
member.summary: Writes both the contents of DataTable and the associated data schema in Xml format to specified output file.
member.param: DataTable object.
Location of the Xml output file.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.SaveDataTableToXmlSchemaFile(System.Data.DataTable,System.String)
member.summary: Writes the data schema in Xsd format to specified output file.
member.param: DataTable object.
Location of the Xsd output file.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.SaveDataSetToXmlFile(System.Data.DataSet,System.String)
member.summary: Writes contents of DataSet in Xml format to specified output file.
member.param: DataSet object.
Location of the Xml output file.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.SaveDataSetWithSchemaToXmlFile(System.Data.DataSet,System.String)
member.summary: Writes both the contents of DataSet and the assoicated data schema in Xml format to specified output file.
member.param: DataSet object.
Location of the Xml output file.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.SaveDataSetToXmlSchemaFile(System.Data.DataSet,System.String)
member.summary: Writes data schema of DataSet in Xsd format to specified output file.
member.param: DataSet object.
Location of the Xsd output file.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.TypeIsUserTable(System.Data.DataRow)
member.summary: Function to determine if the type of table object is a user (base) table. This function is used to eliminate system tables from the output.
member.param: DataRow returned by GetSchema.
member.returns: True if the table is a user or base table.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.GetFullTableName(System.Data.DataRow)
member.summary: Function to build a qualified table name. Ususally this means attaching schema name in front of table name. In some cases both the catalog name and the schema name will be prepended to the table namne. Result depends on the requirements of the database platform implementing this function.
member.param: DataRow returned by GetSchema.
member.returns: Full table name in either schemaname.tablename or catalogname.schemaname.tablename format.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.GetTableNameQualifiers(System.Data.DataRow)
member.summary: Function to return the catalog, schema and name parts of a fully qualified table name. Some databases will only return the schema and name since catalog is not used by those database engines.
member.param: DataRow returned by GetSchema that contains Tables information.
member.returns: Object containing the different qualifiers in the table name.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.RebuildFullTableName(PFDataAccessObjects.PFTableDef,System.String)
member.summary: Routine to recreate with a different schema name. Used when transferring a table definition to a new database.
member.param: Object containing the table definition to be reformatted.
Schema name to apply to the reformatted table name.
member.returns: Table name that includes the new schema name.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.TableExists(PFDataAccessObjects.PFTableDef)
member.summary: Routine uses table name information supplied by a PFTableDef object to determine if a table exists in the database.
member.param: Object containing table definition information.
member.returns: True if table exists; otherwise false.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.DropTable(PFDataAccessObjects.PFTableDef)
member.summary: Routine retrieves table name information supplied by a PFTableDef object to drop (delete) a table in the database.
member.param: Object containing table definition information.
member.returns: True if table no longer exists; otherwise returns false if table still exists.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.GetTableList
member.summary: Retrieves list of tables and their associated schema information contained in the database pointed to by the current connection.
member.returns: Object containing the list of table definitions.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.GetTableList(System.String[],System.String[])
member.summary: Retrieves list of tables and their associated schema information contained in the database pointed to by the current connection.
member.param: Wildard pattern to use when selecting which tables to include. Specify * or null or empty string for pattern to include all tables.
Wildard pattern to use when selecting which tables to exclude. Specify * for pattern to exclude all tables. Specify null or empty string to exclude no tables.
member.returns: Object containing the list of table definitions.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.ConvertTableDefs(PFCollectionsObjects.PFList{PFDataAccessObjects.PFTableDef},System.String)
member.summary: Method to convert table definitions from another database format to the data format supported by this class.
member.param: Object containing the list of table definitions to be converted.
Specify a new schema (owner) name for the tables when they are recreated in the database managed by the current instance.
member.returns: Object containing the list of table definitions after they have been converted to match the data formats of the current instance.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.CreateTablesFromTableDefs(PFCollectionsObjects.PFList{PFDataAccessObjects.PFTableDef})
member.summary: Runs the table create statements contained in the provided tableDefs object.
member.param: Object containing list of table definitions.
member.returns: Number of tables created.
member.remarks: Will not create table if table already exists.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.CreateTablesFromTableDefs(PFCollectionsObjects.PFList{PFDataAccessObjects.PFTableDef},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Runs the table create statements contained in the provided tableDefs object.
member.param: Object containing list of table definitions.

If true and table already exists, table will be dropped and then recreated using the table definition in the supplied PFTableDefs list. If false, table create step is bypassed if table already exists.
member.returns: Number of tables created.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.CopyTableDataFromTableDefs(PFDataAccessObjects.PFDatabase,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Runs the table create statements contained in the provided tableDefs object.
member.param: Database containing source tables..
Schema to use for identifying the destination tables.

If true and table already exists, table will be dropped and then recreated using the table definition in the supplied PFTableDefs list. If false, table create step is bypassed if table already exists.
member.returns: Number of tables created.

member.name: M:PFOracleObjects.PFOracle.CopyTableDataFromTableDefs(PFDataAccessObjects.PFDatabase,System.String[],System.String[],System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Runs the table create statements contained in the provided tableDefs object.
member.param: Database containing source tables..
Wildard pattern to use when selecting which tables to include. Specify * or null or empty string for pattern to include all tables.
Wildard pattern to use when selecting which tables to exclude. Specify * for pattern to exclude all tables. Specify null or empty string to exclude no tables.
Schema to use for identifying the destination tables.

If true and table already exists, table will be dropped and then recreated using the table definition in the supplied PFTableDefs list. If false, table create step is bypassed if table already exists.
member.returns: Number of tables created.
